meanings.definition: To fold or crease something before its intended use.
meanings.sent1: She carefully precreases the paper before starting to cut.
meanings.sent2: He always precreases his origami paper to make folding easier.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionist in her precreases every sheet of wrapping paper before wrapping gifts.
meanings.sent4: The tailor precreases the fabric with precision, ensuring sharp lines in the final garment.
meanings.sent5: Precreasing the fabric helps maintain the shape of the garment over time.

meanings.definition: The act of creating folds or creases in advance.
meanings.sent1: Her careful precreases on the fabric made sewing the dress a breeze.
meanings.sent2: The precreases on the map helped him quickly find his destination.
meanings.sent3: The precreases on the napkin added an elegant touch to the table setting.
meanings.sent4: The precreases on the letter gave it a professional look before it was even opened.
meanings.sent5: The precreases on the envelope kept the contents secure during mailing.

meanings.definition: A line or mark made by folding or creasing something before use.
meanings.sent1: The precreases on the shirt collar gave it a crisp appearance.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the precreases on the book cover from being folded in her bag.
meanings.sent3: The precreases on the pastry dough added a decorative touch to the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The precreases on the document indicated it had been carefully handled.
meanings.sent5: The precreases on the map helped him navigate through the city easily.
